name: BBCWorld
text:
A new strain of flu with the potential to become a pandemic has been identified by scientists

Found recently in China, it‚Äôs carried by pigs but can infect humans

[Thread]

https://t.co/dL6kZccEMo

name: BBCWorld
text:
There is potential it could mutate, spreading easily between people, triggering a global outbreak, researchers say

The virus isn't an immediate problem, but has "all the hallmarks" of being highly adaptable to infect humans & requires close monitoring

https://t.co/dL6kZccEMo https://t.co/b93GHwb2Fe

name: BBCWorld
text:
As it's new, people could have little or no immunity to it

Scientists say the virus in pigs must be closely controlled and swine industry workers should be monitored

https://t.co/dL6kZccEMo https://t.co/Ys1WHgdjyB

name: BBCWorld
text:
This virus has been called G4 EA H1N1

It‚Äôs similar to the 2009 swine flu - which caused a global pandemic - but has some changes

Swine flu is now protected against in the annual flu vaccine
 
https://t.co/dL6kZccEMo https://t.co/PVqoF1Wpyv

name: BBCWorld
text:
The current flu vaccine doesn‚Äôt protect against this new virus, but could be adapted 

"We must not lose sight of potentially dangerous new viruses," says Prof Kin-Chow Chang from Nottingham University

"We should not ignore it"

https://t.co/dL6kZccEMo https://t.co/YEer7jpYPG

name: BBCWorld
text:
Flu viruses change constantly, which is why the vaccine needs to be changed regularly 

Pandemics are still rare events though 
https://t.co/dL6kZccEMo https://t.co/oLiM7g88vG

name: BBCWorld
text:
‚ÄúWe cannot let down our guard on influenza; we need to be vigilant and continue surveillance even during the Covid-19 pandemic," a World Health Organization spokeswoman says

Read more: https://t.co/dL6kZccEMo
